covered: Valid Payload coverage: successful account creation with minimum required fields (TC01), with all required/optional fields (TC02), and with extra/partial inputs (TC03, TC07, TC16).
Invalid Payload coverage: malformed JSON (TC05), empty payload (TC12), and missing required fields (TC06).
Duplicate Submission coverage: duplicate data handling (TC13).
Large Payload coverage: maximum field sizes (TC11).
Validation coverage: header validation and missing header (TC04, TC08).
Server Error Handling coverage: database/system unavailable (TC10).
Integration coverage: retrieval of created account via GET (TC20).
gaps: Rate Limiting: no tests validating throttling or rate limits.
Caching Behavior: no tests asserting ETag/Cache-Control or caching behavior for POST responses.
Internal Server Error (500): no test simulating 500 errors such as database failures.
Forbidden access (403): no test for authenticated-but-not-authorized scenarios.
Content-Type/edge cases: missing or invalid Content-Type header handling beyond X-Killbill-CreatedBy (e.g., other header validations).
recommendations: Add 403 Forbidden test for authenticated-but-not-authorized access.
Add 500 Internal Server Error scenario to simulate database failure.
Add tests to validate caching headers (ETag/Cache-Control) where applicable.
Add tests for Content-Type validation and other header-related edge cases beyond X-Killbill-CreatedBy.
Consider explicit idempotency/duplicate handling tests (e.g., deterministic 409 on duplicates) and clarify policy.
Consider splitting performance tests (TC18) into dedicated load tests for clearer metrics.
